Python.description: High-level, interpreted language known for readability and versatility.

JavaScript.description: The language of the WEB! If you want to make things MOVE, this is IT!
JavaScript.drill_sergeant_take: JavaScript is EVERYWHERE! Master this and you can CONQUER the web!

Go.description: Concurrent programming language developed by Google.
Go.drill_sergeant_take: Go is LEAN, MEAN, and gets the JOB DONE! Learn this and you're UNSTOPPABLE!

Rust.description: Systems programming language focused on memory safety and concurrency.

Assembly.description: Low-level language that directly corresponds to machine instructions.
Assembly.drill_sergeant_take: ASSEMBLY is for the ELITE SOLDIERS! This is where the REAL WORK gets done!
Assembly.sample_code:

    msg db 'Hello, Tux!', 0
section .text
    global _start
_start:
    mov eax, 1
    mov ebx, 0

INTERCAL.description: Intentionally Complicated programming language designed to be absurd.

Perl.description: High-level, general-purpose language known for text processing and system administration.

PHP.description: Server-side scripting language designed for web development.
PHP.drill_sergeant_take: PHP POWERS the WEB! It's BATTLE-TESTED and READY for deployment!

Ruby.description: Dynamic, object-oriented language designed for programmer happiness.
Ruby.drill_sergeant_take: RUBY makes coding ELEGANT! But don't let BEAUTY distract from PERFORMANCE!

Kotlin.description: Modern, concise language fully interoperable with Java.
Kotlin.drill_sergeant_take: KOTLIN is JAVA 2.0! MODERN, SAFE, and ready for ANDROID WARFARE!

MATLAB.description: High-performance language for numerical computing and visualization.
MATLAB.drill_sergeant_take: MATLAB is for ENGINEERS! CALCULATE, VISUALIZE, and DOMINATE the numbers!

Visual Basic.drill_sergeant_take: VISUAL BASIC is CLASSIC! Old school doesn't mean WEAK, soldier!
Visual Basic.sample_code:
Module TuxProgram
    Sub Main()
        Console.WriteLine("Hello, Tux!")
    End Sub

        Return "Welcome, " & name & "!"
    End Function

R.drill_sergeant_take: R is for STATISTICIANS! Master the DATA and you master the BATTLEFIELD!

Swift.description: Powerful and intuitive programming language for iOS and macOS.
Swift.drill_sergeant_take: SWIFT is APPLE'S WEAPON! Fast, safe, and ready for iOS DEPLOYMENT!

COBOL.description: Business-oriented language still powering critical financial systems.

COBOL.sample_code:

Fortran.description: First high-level language, optimized for numerical and scientific computing.
Fortran.drill_sergeant_take: FORTRAN is the ORIGINAL! The GRANDFATHER of all high-level languages!
Fortran.sample_code:
program TuxProgram
    implicit none
    print *, 'Hello, Tux!'
end program TuxProgram

Modern Fortran.description: Modern version of Fortran with object-oriented and parallel programming features.
Modern Fortran.drill_sergeant_take: MODERN FORTRAN combines OLD POWER with NEW TACTICS! The best of BOTH worlds!
Modern Fortran.sample_code:
program TuxModern
    use iso_fortran_env
    implicit none
    
    print *, 'Hello, Tux!'
    
contains
    function greet(name) result(msg)
        character(len=*), intent(in) :: name
        character(len=100) :: msg
        msg = 'Welcome, ' // trim(name) // '!'
    end function
end program

Bash.drill_sergeant_take: BASH is your COMMAND LINE WEAPON! Master the SHELL, control the SYSTEM!

Lisp.description: Second-oldest high-level language, known for AI and symbolic computation.
Lisp.drill_sergeant_take: LISP teaches you to THINK DIFFERENTLY! Embrace the PARENTHESES, soldier!

F#.description: Functional-first language for .NET with strong type inference.

Zig.description: Modern systems programming language focusing on robustness and optimization.

D.description: Systems programming language with C-like performance and modern features.

Haskell.description: Pure functional programming language with strong static typing.
Haskell.drill_sergeant_take: HASKELL is PURE FUNCTIONAL! No side effects, just MATHEMATICAL PRECISION!
Haskell.sample_code:
main :: IO ()
main = putStrLn "Hello, Tux!"

greet :: String -> String
greet name = "Welcome, " ++ name ++ "!"

Elixir.description: Functional language built on Erlang VM for distributed, fault-tolerant systems.

Elixir.sample_code:

function greet(name)

end

Nim.description: Statically typed language combining Python-like syntax with C-like performance.
Nim.drill_sergeant_take: NIM is ELEGANT and EFFICIENT! Python's READABILITY with C's SPEED!
Nim.sample_code:
echo "Hello, Tux!"

proc greet(name: string): string =
  result = "Welcome, " & name & "!"
